duck: Joachim (surname), a surname ultimately derived from the Biblical king Jehoiakim
Joachim was the husband of Saint Anne and the father of Mary, the mother of Jesus.

His compositions include violin concertos and an overture to Hamlet.

{{Infobox saint |name=Saint Joachim |birth_date=100 BC unknown real day |death_date=unknown |feast_day=July 26 (Anglican Communion), (Roman Catholicism); September 9 (Eastern Orthodox Church), (Greek Catholics); March 20 (General Roman Calendar, 1584-1738); Sunday after the Octave of the Assumption (General Roman Calendar, 1738-1913); August 16 (General Roman Calendar, 1913- 1969) |venerated_in=Roman Catholic Church

Anglican Communion

Aglipayan Church |image=Santi gioacchino e anna.jpg |imagesize=275px |caption=Saints Joachim and Anne, parents of the Virgin Mary |birth_place= Jerusalem |death_place=Jerusalem |titles=Father of the Blessed Virgin Mary; Confessor |beatified_date= |beatified_place= |beatified_by= |canonized_date=Pre- Congregation |canonized_place= |canonized_by= |attributes=Lamb, doves, with Saint Anne or Mary |patronage=Adjuntas, Puerto Rico, fathers, grandparents, Fasnia (Tenerife) |major_shrine= |suppressed_date= |issues= }} 'Joachim' ("he whom YHWH has set up", Hebrew: יְהוֹיָקִים Yəhôyāqîm, Greek Ἰωακείμ Iōākeím) was the husband of Saint Anne and the father of Mary the mother of Jesus, according to the Roman Catholic, Orthodox, and Anglican traditions. The story of Joachim and Anne first appears in the apocryphal Gospel of James. Joachim and Anne are not mentioned in the Bible.Ronald Brownrigg, Canon Brownrigg Who's Who in the New Testament 2001 ISBN 0-415-26036-1 page T-62 His feast day is July 26.
wiki.title: joachim
